instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1989: What is A1989? A1989 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2018, 2019 with EMC 3124, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-00850..
definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP0V9_SSD0: What is PP0V9_SSD0? This is a power rail for the soldered on SSD on newer Macbooks. .
definitions.PP1V8_SSD0: What is PP1V8_SSD0? PP1V8_SSD0 is a power rail responsible for powering the soldered on NAND memory for the SSD on newer Macbook Pros.
definitions.C7020: What is C7020? Capacitor between current sense lines on ISL6259 chip for charger current sensing, you should measure around 20.02 ohms across this. Often when the resistance across this capacitor is higher it is because one of the current sense resistors going to the ISL6259 chip has failed. When current sensing resistors between the shunt resistor and the ISL6259 power IC have failed the ISL6259 cannot gauge how much current is being drawn from the charger, which will cause the ISL6259 to stop drawing as much power from the charger as a safety precaution. Symptoms are low voltage on PPBUS_G3H, quarter fan spin, boot looping, or battery not charging..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird issues
threads.message:
Good day friends, 

I have actually this board here and I don't really know where to start to search. Sometimes it power on with apple logo and it is booting with full fan speed and very slow. Sometimes it is drawing current about 600-700mA fan full speed and nothing happens no screen. Tried to make diagnose but it hangs in the last minute. When it not turns on I leave it over night, then I can turn on 2-3 times. Also not possible turn on with battery. Sometimes when turn on a questionmark appears for 1-2 second and the it is booting. So maybe something wrong with ssd. I checked 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 12,6V 
<SIGNAL>PP2V7_NAND_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 2,55V 
<SIGNAL>PP1V8_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 1,8V 
<SIGNAL>PP0V9_SSD0</SIGNAL> = 0,9V

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird issues
threads.message:
Tried to start in safe mode?
Did you try with known good battery?

Full fans speed is usually sign of triggered temperature sensor.
Some machines may have this symptom when battery is not detected; maybe not in this case.

Check resistance over <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR>/23 (ohm scale).
Also check <SIGNAL>SMC_AVREF</SIGNAL> voltage.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird issues
threads.message:
I tried this mainboard in complete functional top case and still same. Also tried a working one in this top case, is also working. So it looks like it is a mainboard problem. <CAPACITOR>C7020</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C7023</CAPACITOR> is both about 2,5 ohms. <SIGNAL>SMC_AVREF</SIGNAL> = 1,25V

Bott in safe not possible, it is loading till 70% and then it stuck. Today I got it one time to boot up to login screen of course with fan full speed and very slow everything. So far with this problem I was always able to boot up and check with software which sensor is bad. Without booting this will be hard

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird issues
threads.message:
Try DFU revive.
If no important data, try restore too; it will erase SSD.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1989</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> weird issues
threads.message: Juist managed to login and started TG pro. It says GPU and hard drive temperature sensors may not be working properly. But temperatures looks ok.
